Package xxl.collections

Contains an alternatively collections framework and miscellaneous utility classes to handle with the Java collections framework.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Bag The interface bag represents a data type that is able to contain any kind of object and performs no duplicate detection.
FIFOBag The interface FIFO bag represents a FIFO (first in, first out) iteration over the elements of a bag.
FIFOQueue The interface FIFO queue represents a FIFO (first in, first out) iteration over a collection of elements (also known as a sequence) with a peek method.
LIFOBag The interface LIFO bag represents a LIFO (last in, first out) iteration over the elements of a bag.
LIFOQueue The interface LIFO queue represents a LIFO (last in, first out) iteration over a collection of elements (also known as a sequence) with a peek method.
Queue The interface queue represents an user specified iteration over a collection of elements (also known as a sequence) with a peek method.
 

Class Summary
AbstractBag This class provides a skeletal implementation of the Bag interface, to minimize the effort required to implement this interface.
AbstractQueue This class provides a skeletal implementation of the Queue interface, to minimize the effort required to implement this interface.
ArrayBag This class provides an implementation of the Bag interface that internally uses a array with fixed size to store its elements.
ArrayQueue This class provides a resizable-array implementation of the Queue interface with a FIFO (first in, first out) strategy.
BinarySearchTreeMap This class provides an implementation of the Map interface that internally uses a binary search tree to store its key-value mappings.
BinarySearchTreeSet This class provides an implementation of the Set interface that internally uses a binary search tree to store its elements.
Container A container is the top class for all classes that deal with the management of a set of objects.
CounterContainer This class decorates a container with a counter functionality and counts every call of an insert, get, update and remove method.
DecoratorBag The class provides a decorator for a bag that follows the Decorator Design Pattern (for further details see Structural Patterns, Decorator in Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software by Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, and John Vlissides).
DecoratorContainer The class provides a decorator for a container that follows the Decorator Design Pattern (for further details see Structural Patterns, Decorator in Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software by Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, and John Vlissides).
DecoratorQueue The class provides a decorator for a queue that follows the Decorator Design Pattern (for further details see Structural Patterns, Decorator in Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software by Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, and John Vlissides).
DistinctQueue This class provides a wrapper for a queue that performes a simple duplicate elimination.
DynamicArrayBag This class provides an implementation of the Bag interface that internally uses a resizable array to store its elements.
DynamicHeap This class provides a dynamical resizable-array implementation of the heap datastructure.
EmptyBag This class provides an empty bag.
EmptyContainer This class provides an empty container.
Heap This class provides the heap datastructure.
ListBag This class provides an implementation of the Bag interface that internally uses a list to store its elements.
ListQueue This class provides an implementation of the Queue interface with a FIFO (first in, first out) strategy that internally uses a list to store its elements.
Lists This class contains various methods for manipulating lists.
MapContainer This class provides an implementation of the Container interface that internally uses a map to store the (id,*)-elements.
MapEntry This class provides a straightforward implementation of the Map.Entry interface from java.util.
MappedList The class provides a mapping of a list with a given function.
ReversedList The class provides a reversed list.
StackQueue This class provides an implementation of the Queue interface with a LIFO (last in, first out) strategy that internally uses a stack to store its elements.
UnmodifiableBag This class provides a decorator for a given bag that cannot be modified.
UnmodifiableContainer This class provides a decorator for a given container that cannot be modified.
UnmodifiableQueue This class provides a decorator for a given queue that cannot be modified.
 

Package xxl.collections Description

Contains an alternatively collections framework and miscellaneous utility classes to handle with the Java collections framework. In contrast to the Java collections framework, any collection of this framework supports a close method. This methode releases any system resources associated with collection and is very important for collections using external resources like files or JDBC resources.
